results.title: Death of a beauty = Mei ren zhi si
results.creator_credit: Tianshan Film Studio and Guang Chunlan
results.brief_description:
The film is based on an ancient legend taking place in Southern Xinjiang three hundred years ago. Mariam and her father lived in an old mansion. One day Mariam was singing on the balcony and her cousin incidentally saw her unveiled face, which terribly scared him. What had happened to Mariam was that two years ago when her father was seriously ill, he made a will saying that Mariam would inherit all his wealth. This enraged Mariam’s stepmother, who set a fire on the house and Mariam’s face was severely disfigured. Mariam’s stepmother had since controlled the mansion. During the Corban festival, the royal family, Yunus came to visit Mariam’s father. The prince, Kaisal surprisingly found out that the veiled Mariam was the little girl that he met on a hunting five years ago. Kaisal promised that he would marry Mariam. Soon Kaisal’s father sent people to propose the marriage, which put Mariam’s father into a difficult situation. Mariam’s stepmother drove Mariam off and made their servant, Palida pretend to be the bride. The kind-hearted Palida told Kaisal the truth and poisoned herself. Kaisal was furious about what had happened and went to look for Mariam. Kaisal found Mariam eventually but Mariam jumped off the cliff as she saw Kaisal running towards her. She did not want the prince to marry her who were no longer the girl he had met. Mariam’s stepmother died in a fire and the film ends in Kaisal holding Mariam walking on the desert in the sunset.

The film is directed by a female director, Guang Chunlan. Guang also produced The Mysterious Caravan (1985), The Girl Who Wanted to Dance (1983) and so on in the Tianshan Film Studio. Throughout the 1980s, Guang made a number of films representing the rich local culture and lifestyles in Xinjiang. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Death in a French garden = Peril en la demeure
results.creator_credit: Gasmont-EleFilm-T F 1 Film Productions, Emmanuel Schlumberger and Michel DeVille
results.brief_description: One day a man walks into a house where his innocence, his youth and his life are at stake. Within the house is an exceedingly beautiful young girl and her mysterious, alluring and dangerous mother. A powerful husband. A hired killer. A threatening atmosphere where nothing is as it seems. Sex and power; possession and manipulation; desire and despair; death in a French garden. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Death and the maiden = Si shen yu shao nu
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Academy and Lin Hongtong
results.brief_description:
Synopsis:
An old man committed suicide as he realized he had no more than three months to live because of liver cancer. A 26-year old girl lost hope for life as one of her legs was amputated because of blood disease. Death and the Maiden tells the story of how an old man and a girl encouraged each other to fight against death and live life with hope. The old man, a writer, condemns the doctor for saving his life as this would only make him suffer in his final days of life. However, the old man promised to live on in order to help a young lady he encountered in the hospital to survive the hardship in her life and marry her boyfriend. The liver cancer took the old man’s life eventually and the girl lost the other leg. However, after the old man’s death, the girl is determined to live life with hope. The film ends in the girl’s boyfriend pushing a wheelchair for her, both full of hope for a new life together.

Cultural History of the Film:
The screenwriter of the film, Shi Tiesheng, is a well-known writer in China and Shi is himself a disabled person and wheel-chair bound. The film was devoted to the UN Decade of Disabled Persons, 1983-1992.

Researcher’s Comments:
In the 1980s and 1990s, the Chinese government set up various role models, among which a most famous is a disabled lady, Zhang Haidi, to encourage people, particularly young people, to have firm belief in the socialist course. This film is produced in such a background and reflects the Chinese film authorities’ view that a primary function of film is to educate people.

Additional Information:
Good cinematography and editing.

(3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)

results.title: Dearborn holiday
results.creator_credit: Ford Motor Company, MPO Productions and Jerry McMechan
results.brief_description: Many people visit Dearborn to see cars of the present turned out at the Ford Motor Company Works. Cars of the future are on view at the Ford Rotunda. Other tourist attractions are the Henry Ford Museum and Greenfield Village, centres for a historic collection, including both the early years of the Ford motor car and such diverse objects as Thomas Edison’s laboratory and the Cape Cod windmill built by the Pilgrims.

results.title: Dear Theo
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Larose and Jean Beaudin
results.brief_description: After a serious car accident, a young woman whose parents are separated and like herself intent on lives of pleasure or business, is placed in a room with a seventy year old lady, who writes to and receives loving letters from her eighty-one year old husband to whom she has been married for nearly fifty years. As time passes the two become warm friends until Josette dies leaving a special gift for Julie who then, passes it on

results.title: Dear God in heaven
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Rufus Guds and Ian Fowler
results.brief_description: Heaven rests precariously upon the ozone layer. When a suburban family habitually uses fluorocarbon propelled aerosols the direct result is the loss of God’s personal TV When the situation worsens he calls for the aid of Jesus and the apostles. Cast includes Ted Venn, Evonne Shields, Nigel Buesst, Jan Marnell.
